content: Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 07 Mar 2019Are there any preferred shares in Singapore?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 08 Mar 2019Yes there are a few. One example is DBS preference shares.0 comments1

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 02 Sep 2019Many companies have preferred share structures in Singapore.They get paid first, so if there is a limited amount, they will have priority.0 comments0

Isaac Chan, Business  at NUSLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 08 Mar 2019Yep! They usually get paid dividends before dividends are paid to common share holders. Dividends for preferred stockholders are usually paid first before common shareholders, but these preferred shareholders tend to give up their voting rights0 comments0
